Summary: Bright light, not far in the distance that changed colors and looked like a ball of light
divs: sighting detailson the evening of saturday 11\07\09, as we celebrated my son's 18th b-day at our home, my son said he was leaving with 2 of his friends to go camping. he came back to the door and called me outside so i can see what he was looking at in the sky. there on the horizon, to the east, was a big light. it at first glance appeared to be a big fire ball, but was not leaving a trail, as we continued to watch this light we noticed radiating lights, it was constantly changing into red, blue, yellow, green colors. it seemed to be going south and then veered to the east and it was as big as probably 3 x the size of a commercial plane. even tough i couldn't see it's shape because it was dark, i did not think it was a plane because was not making any noise nor did it have little blinking lights like a plane has. believe me, i have seen plenty of planes and you could see a plane in the distance and this light was not off any plane. this light was visible for some time because my son had time to run back to the door to call me outside, i then ran back threw the house to the back door and called my husband to come outside to the front of the house to see the light and then i ran back in and grabbed the camera off the table and we watched the light for about a minute or two. my husband was in the usaf and he could tell me if this was an airplane or not. he was amazed and told me it was not a plane. we had a house full of relatives who also witnessed it but they said if anything it was an airplane on fire? but not an ufo. like i mentioned, i was standing in the front of my house, so i went into the house and got my camera. because i was shaking, i gave the camera to my husband so he recorded for about a minute, but it wasn't as bright as it was in the begining but you can still see it and the color changes. the light continued traveling south east and then it just disappeared!
trends: There have been no other sightings in Rockton
This sighting has never been favorited.
